newsitem.title: JAPAN: BankAmerica cuts Tokyo jobs but looks to expand.
newsitem.headline: BankAmerica cuts Tokyo jobs but looks to expand.

text.p: BankAmerica Corp. said Monday it will cut 50 percent of its 200 jobs in Tokyo but added that it will also look to expand here in the future as deregulation of the financial industry unfolds.

Arun Duggal, general manager of the bank's Japan operations, told Reuters the Tokyo branch of the U.S. bank will eliminate the jobs, mainly back-office jobs to be moved to Hong Kong, as part of a reorganization. A specific timetable for the cuts has not been set.
Meanwhile, the bank also plans to establish a securities arm in Japan in 1997, after receiving approval from the Finance Ministry, he said.

"The Japanese capital market is likely to offer attractive opportunities once deregulation as outlined by Prime Minister (Ryutaro) Hashimoto begins," he said. "It is a very exciting and timely shift for us."
Duggal said no decision had been made on the size of a new bond market unit.

The bank said that it is looking to to strengthen its role in Tokyo's derivatives, securities, structured export finance and securitization business. It said the traditional bank business appears to have limited growth and profit opportunities for the bank in Japan.
